data.event: The area opened for settlement in the 1750s as Township No. 9, chartered as Murrayfield on October 31, 1765.

event.title: was incorporated as Chester on February 21, 1783

data.event: The town was incorporated as Chester on February 21, 1783.
The Western Railroad (later Boston & Albany Railroad) opened to Chester on May 24, 1841.

event.title: August 2, 1975, the temperature in Chester rose

data.event: On August 2, 1975, the temperature in Chester rose to 107 °F (42 °C).

event.title: January 12, 1981, the temperature at Chester fell

data.event: However, on January 12, 1981, the temperature at Chester fell to −35 °F (−37 °C), the coldest temperature ever recorded in Massachusetts.
